intro: Themistoclesia woytkowskii, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves. The flowers bloom in spring and are pollinated primarily by bees and other insects.
